results.title: Alexander Skarsgard’s Viking Dream
results.abstract: Stories from his grandfather inspired what would eventually become “The Northman.” But it took years of development and then seven months in the mud to complete.

results.title: Michel Bouquet, Award-Winning French Actor, Dies at 96
results.abstract: One of his country’s great theater performers, he went on to appear in more than 100 films playing ordinary men whose surface blandness masked complex lives.

multimedia.caption: Michel Bouquet performing in Moliere's “The Imaginary Invalid” in Paris in 1970. He was one of France’s greatest stage actors who found a niche in films.
Michel Bouquet performing in Moliere's “The Imaginary Invalid” in Paris in 1970. He was one of France’s greatest stage actors who found a niche in films.

results.title: Let Him Entertain You: Billy Crystal Returns to Broadway
results.abstract: The comedian is starring in “Mr. Saturday Night,” a musical version of his 1992 movie about an aging performer who won’t accept that his time in the spotlight is up.

multimedia.caption: “The worst nightmare is, do you wake up one day and you’re not funny anymore?” Billy Crystal, 74, said of the anxiety that comes with being an aging comedian. “Do you wake up and you’re not relevant?”
multimedia.copyright: Philip Montgomery for The New York Times

results.title: Laurence Fishburne Cools Down With Classic Jazz and Cashmere Blankets
results.abstract: The actor is back on Broadway for a revival of David Mamet’s “American Buffalo.” He discusses his other must-haves, like a chef’s knife, trampolines and crystals.

results.title: New Era Begins at Warner Bros., Tinged With Nostalgia
results.abstract: With a new owner, the 99-year-old movie studio appears headed back to its traditional sweet spot as an entertainment company. But the business of Hollywood is no longer the same.

multimedia.caption: David Zaslav, Discovery’s chief executive, will run the new company, which is called, with no small amount of symbolism, Warner Bros. Discovery.

results.title: Will Smith Barred From Attending Oscars for 10 Years After Slap
results.abstract: Smith, who won best actor this year, can still be nominated for Oscars, industry officials said, but will be unable to attend the Academy Awards ceremony and other events.

results.title: Idris Elba, Gamer (That’s Why He Was So Keen on ‘Sonic the Hedgehog 2’)
results.abstract: In a career of action movies and dramas, Elba embraced the chance to voice Knuckles, the brawny adversary in the new sequel. Just don’t ask him about 007.
